website_summaries.verdict: With over 100 projects and numerous working parts, you won't find a more educational engineering toy with more to offer for a lower price.
pros: A great toy for teaching children age 7 and up the fundamentals of STEM applications in an award-winning package
no tools required to complete projects
cons: Some consumers reported a few missing or faulty pieces upon arrival

website_summaries.verdict: Teaches kids about simple circuitry. Colorful, fun, and rewarding for those who follow the directions.
pros: Valuable STEM learning for a reasonable price
cons: This toy does not deliver a comprehensive understanding of electronics concepts
Rather, it provides an intriguing first experience of putting circuits together

customer_reviews.title: I have to admit - it's better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to a very bright 7 year old last year for Christmas... he asked for it, and I was more than happy to lure another young mind to the dark side. This year he's asking for an expansion pack, and still putting projects together. His younger brother wants his own set, too. It's a hit. From the adult perspective, this is some very, very basic stuff. I found myself wishing for a little more theory in the instruction book, but I remind myself that this is the very basic entry level kit intended for young kids. Even so, he's starting to figure out the very general ideas about how some of this stuff works.
customer_reviews.author: Dale B.

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy Grandma
customer_reviews.text: Usually I am extremely pleased with Amazon Prime . It has become my go to shopping place. However, my recent order of "Circuits" for my twin grandsons arrived with one box perfectly new and ready to gift and the other box torn apart, repaired with inadequate tape and a note that said it had been checked and all the pieces were accounted for. How can I give one perfect box to one grandson and another shedded box to the other for their birthdays? I am unsure how this happened, but something is very wrong with the supplier.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: I bought thirteen (13) of these sets for a class that I teach. One (1) of them is missing the "Alarm IC (U2)" and five (5) of them's "Spacewar IC (U3)" are not functioning. This means we are unable to do multiple projects. The rest works well. I left message with seller over a week ago. I have not heard back. I plan on return these bad sets. I am not sure I want to take chance to order replacements.
customer_reviews.author: franky642

customer_reviews.title: Love the set. Hoping for good customer service
customer_reviews.text: My sons loved this set and were incredibly excited to get through the first two activities. We couldn't get the 3rd activity to work....thank goodness for the great troubleshooting guide. We were able to determine that the red wire was defective and have requested a replacement. We are hopeful it comes quickly and appreciate the ease of ordering the replacement. However, I have to give 3 stars because it seems a wire would be an inexpensive enough piece to provide backups in the kit. Waiting to use the gift is less than ideal!
customer_reviews.author: Alyson

customer_reviews.title: Smoking Parts! Do Not Buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kids for Christmas. They were so excited when they opened it and began playing with it Christmas night. About thirty minutes later kids started screaming and when we ran into the room one of the circuits was smoking. I told them to put the kit away immediately. What a shame. Unfortunately, I purchased it in October, ahead of time for Christmas, so I cannot return it or get a replacement. What a shame. So much promise.
customer_reviews.author: LovinLife

customer_reviews.title: Great STEM teaching tool for kids.
customer_reviews.text: I had an elenco board when I was about 7, the old type with the coil spring connectors and the items fixed in place. This new snap arrangement is much more intuitive in that you can follow a diagram or trace the flow of electricity more easily. The plastic pieces are sturdy and snap together firmly. My 4 1/2 year old can assemble it without help. She was able to recreate one of the simple circuits (the soaring fan one) after seeing it only one time. Great toy that encourages learning as well. I will likely add componants or another kit in the future as she gets more comfortable with this one..
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B Boor

customer_reviews.title: BURNED MY GRANDCHILD
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson for xmas, he absolutely loved it and spent hours doing the projects. I sat with him and aided in a few that were more difficulte as he is 7. We had a good time together putting together the projects. I suppervised more than helped in most cases. My daughter called a few days later saying the set caught one of the batteries on fire and my grandaughter'finger got burned. She contacted the co and they were not concwrned at all, just offered to replacw the bad part. I see ours is not the only complaint concerning this issue
customer_reviews.author: lynn fitzsimmons

customer_reviews.title: This was a birthday present for my daughter, and ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present for my daughter, and she was very excited to learn how electricity works. Unfortunately the package was missing close to half its pieces. I had ordered an Amazon warehouse deal--and understood that although the box might have minor damage, the toy had been checked out and had no problems. This was very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: There really aren't good explanations. I'd like to add that while I ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know anything about circuits, so I got this thinking I could learn with my son. It's exciting seeing the project work, but I can't say we understand any more than we did before. There really aren't good explanations. I'd like to add that while I got the junior set, my neighbor got the big set. The big set has all the same stuff as the junior (even the first half of the projects are exactly the same as all of the junior's) only it has a lot more parts and twice as many projects, so I'd recommend just getting the bigger set with more pieces, I kind of feel ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: An absolute must! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This is my son’s favorite Christmas gift. I had no idea what Snap Circuits were until he put them on his Xmas list. If you have a child in your life who is into building and experimenting this is the gift for them. The instructions are color coded and easy to follow. My son is 6 and doesn’t need any help to make the circuits. He is so proud of himself when he hits the “on” switch and the circuit works. There aren’t too many pieces and each has a specific compartment, so they won’t get lost. The book contains so many different variations of circuits. This is sure to be a favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: All 3 of my kids enjoy this. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My boys are ages 5, 7 and 9 and they all love this and have been playing with it together well. They followed directions independently for about 5 setups and now are creating their own circuits to experiment what will make the lights and fan work. They like to tap the fan to make it fly off the circuit as you can see in the video. Each piece has a place in the plastic storage tray so all the pieces can easily go back in the box to help keep track and avoid missing pieces. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Birthday Girl loved it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fun toy for kids who want to make a motor work or a lamp light but aren’t quite old enough to sit down with wires and batteries. I wish the instructions, which are otherwise excellent, did a little more explanation of how and why electricity works and what each piece actually does as part of each project, so you would be able to create your own setups more knowledgeably. We borrowed a set from the public library which had a few non-working pieces, but have had no problems with our set yet.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Educational and fun!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 3 years old, and he was excited to see how the Jr. circuits projects can be done by working together with his dad. He likes the song sang by the speaker, and feels excited seeing the flying rotor part. this kit is simple, easy to carry, explain to little ones, educational and fun. I would like to recommend to other parents who have STEM background or want their kids to gain basic electrical knowledge. This a cool product created by talented, caring and interesting engineers, I think.
customer_reviews.author: Bolu Wang

customer_reviews.title: Not writing reviews often - very pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I kind of expected a normal-for-amazon bunch of low quality plastic parts packed together with some dubious instructions in broken English. Instead: - you can feel that the parts are of good quality plastic and well thought out - it's big enough without being overwhelming, lots of interesting combinations are possible - independently of the electronics, laying out the circuit is a spatial game in itself - the instructions are just very, very good. Lots of experiments described, varied, with follow ups, in a decently printed leaflet. You can feel that this was written by people who liked that, and it genuinely enhances the value of the kit by a mile.
customer_reviews.author: Eoerl

customer_reviews.title: Impressive educational value and enjoyment
customer_reviews.text: Very simple, concise way to teach kids about electrical currents. It’s hands on, so it makes learning fun. It’s a great way to introduce kids to the electrical field. The pieces snap to a grid, so you just match the diagram and voila, you have a working electrical system. I had the chance to explain to my kids what a resistor does in an electrical circuit on one of the projects. And then show them the practical application. I’m impressed with the quality of this product as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and great for curious kids
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent today my son absolutely loves this he just can’t stop playing with this he’s had it for a while and as he’s been using it all day and getting more and more complex with the choices that he has and it’s really great to see him using his brain and making the most of his time
customer_reviews.author: StephenShu

customer_reviews.title: both my kids love this
customer_reviews.text: My 9yr old son and 6yr old daughter both love this. We let them do this on their own and provide very little help. If at the end it doesn't turn out we have them look at the picture and what they created and ask them if it looks identical. They end up finding out their mistake and fix accordingly and are so excited at the end when it works out especially knowing we really didn't help them, they did it on their own.
customer_reviews.author: Torres

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my grandson but he wasn’t interested in building with them. I have since learned he has some mild autism and just isn’t interested in these types of things. They would be a good toy for a child that is interested in building with blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Countrygal

customer_reviews.title: I bought this as a present to my kids from ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a present to my kids from the Elf on Shelf. The elf also set up a circuit so when the kids clapped their hands, and a horn sounded. So, "the elf" set up this circuit, but when I clapped my hands, nothing happened. The instructions say that if it doesn't work, try tapping on it. So, I tapped on it, and the horn honked. Meaning, the circuit was set up correctly, but it just doesn't work the way it is supposed to. Clapping your hands to make a horn sound is exciting for little kids. Tapping on a circuit is NOT exciting for little kids. Big let down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Declining build quality
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the set new on Amazon in 2018. The box has a copyright date of 2017. The quality appears to have gone down over time. I found the same exact set at a thrift store with a copyright date of 2002 and purchased that for back up parts. I’m including a picture of the fan piece from both sets. The thrift store set from 2002 is so much sturdy than the 2017 set. The 2017 fan broke immediately and is now taped together. Overall a great concept and my kids love it but I wish they wouldn’t have made the build quality cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: GoBucky

customer_reviews.title: My 8yr old child plays so well and constructs various projects
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kit and my 8yr old constructs projects looking into the book. She is now relating the projects to real world situations. I monitor a bit on how she is doing, but the manual is self sufficient for kids to follow and construct. I bought a few of these later and gave as a gift to her friends too. I would definitely recommend this kit for any child as it develops essential skills.
customer_reviews.author: Guru

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for stimulating your child's imagination
customer_reviews.text: Although it says ages 8 and above, i bought this for my four and a half year old who had finished the snap circuits beginner. I had to guide him with this beginners circuits as the circuits are a bit ,ore complex. But once he got the hang of it he did a few on his own. I still play with him with the more complex circuits. Overall, he loves this toy and spends hours playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5yo enjoys it
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the cooler toys in a while. Got this for my 4yo about to turn 5yo in a few months. He loves it. He can't do it on his own but he is learning how to use a grid and is proud when the light, motor or speaker work. I have him identify the parts and together we use the grid to connect them. He asks to use it daily. My 3.5yo is not there yet. Recommend for 4+yo if they're excited about science!
customer_reviews.author: ms

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought these! Perfect quiet activity for my 7 year old when younger siblings are napping. Instructions looked like they might be a bit confusing but he has had no issues putting together these circuit. We follow up with asking him why a circuit worked to get his little brain thinking a little more about it. Definitely recommend these, and I will 100% be buying additional sets!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Educational, fun, interesting and challenging for kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: This is fun for the adults and kids. My 6 year old can do some of the projects on her own and my 3 year old is fascinated with it. He’s already starting to understand how to put a project together. This is a great way to introduce kids to programming, science, cause and effect and more. The sets are buildable so the more advanced sets can build up on to the first set. It’s pretty cool to see the fan work or a light turn on and it encourages critical thinking and seductive reasoning when something doesn’t go as planned. (I.e., the fan turned on but not the light, what went wrong?, how do we fix it? Etc).
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, faulty parts
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter's sixth birthday. She is a builder at heart so this was perfect for her. She loved it as we went through some of the basic setups. Sadly once we got past the space battle sound unit we hit an issue. Anytime we attempted to use one of the other sound modules the experiment was dead in the water. We could put the space battle sound module in place and it works. Would be a five star if all the parts functioned properly.
customer_reviews.author: Joe G

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant on purchasing this for my 10 year old son but I am so glad that I did! I love how easy it snaps together and comes apart to rebuild another creation. I love that you can add more sets to it and I LOVE that the directions are so easy to follow! Its nicely packaged and everything is nicely labeled to make it easier to use. I will definitely buy more sets! I home educate him, this is a fun project that teaches so many things. Great for any hands on learner!!!
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 12 year old son who loves science and building things. This book gives step by step instructions with pictures on how to put each experiment together. This kept him occupied for hours at a time. He has completed each experiment several times and has also started making a few experiments on his own. This is such a cool kit for a electronics lover to learn and have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: My 6YR old loves this. Just as a side note it does require assistance from an adult (even I have a hard time with some of set ups) as some of the pictures are hard to translate for my son. A step by step or closer look at the diagram would help tremendously! It’s hard to tell wether the bars are on top of or under the other bars etc. Otherwise. It’s a great learning toy &, am very pleased. Has even taught me a couple things!
customer_reviews.author: Robin B.

customer_reviews.title: Not many projects
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old got the more advanced version for Christmas and my 6 year old loved it so we bought her this jr version. It works well and the directions are easy to follow. The circuits work as instructed, but the different plans really just create various different noises and my six year old was not impressed. Spend the extra money on the advanced version vs this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene Kohnen

customer_reviews.title: Useful for anyone—kids to adults learn about circuits
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this was as much for me as it was for my toddler. He loves putting things together and taking them apart. Letting him snap the pieces together and take them apart without the battery pack is harmless, and when we have the circuits put together, he loves flipping the switch, pressing the button, and making the lights and fan turn on and off. The underlying concept of electricity is beyond his level of development so far. However... at 20 months old, this has helped my wife and me teach him to count from 1 to 5.
customer_reviews.author: bigdave45678

customer_reviews.title: Fun Kit, Connectors a Little Tight For Small Hands
customer_reviews.text: Love this kit, really a fun product that we have been using over the last few months as a nightly project to build new circuits and talk about the changes with a 5 year old. She loves making progress in the included guide, checking off things as we complete them. The only knock I have on the kit is that the button connectors are just a little tight and she has trouble getting them apart for our use, and other reviewers would certainly complain if they were too easy to remove, so I understand the choice of tolerance there.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Allred

customer_reviews.title: Great mix of creativity and science. My kids love it.
customer_reviews.text: My two grade-school aged girls got to play with one of these at our local library. They really seemed to enjoy it. I want to encourage their interest in the physical sciences whenever I can, so I got them one for a valentines gift. They love it! Comes with lots of options and pieces. Easy to put together and comes with an instruction book showing the different designs.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect....
customer_reviews.text: Our 6 year old grandson LOVES Legos. I consider him an advanced Lego builder. For Christmas I was looking for something besides Legos that he could play with that would still have the basic "putting together to create" aspect. Well this was a complete success. He loves it and there so many different configurations that he can play with it over and over.
customer_reviews.author: NaNaC

customer_reviews.title: Superb Learning
customer_reviews.text: This product is physically durable, fun, works as advertised, has plenty of experiments, and I am really glad I bought this for my 6 year old daughter. It does help that I have a background in electronics so I can offer explanations. My daughter actually comes to me to ask to do the next experiment ! I could not have asked for a better product. Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grandchildren love to use this!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my 1st Snap Circuits Jr SC-100 a year ago. Great thinking/learning kit for them to use. It is so popular with my grandchildren that this is my 2nd Snap Circuit Jr Sc-100 I have purchased. When one child has it out there is almost always another that also wants to do it. I have just ordered the Arcade Snap Circuit, but have yet to receive it.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Michael

customer_reviews.title: A great STEM project kit for kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these as Christmas gifts. One for my youngest granddaughter and the other for my great grandson. Both have thoroughly enjoyed their sets. My grandaughter started with the diagrammed projects and very quickly moved on to experimenting on her own. The one initial disappointment was the motor in my great grandson's kit wasn't working properly. A quick email to the manufacturer and in 5 days a brand new motor arrived in the mail at no cost. All in all, I cannot recommend this kit highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mom approved edutainment toy! 👍
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Snap Circuit set on a whim because it was on sale. My kids have played with it every night since this set arrived! It's a great learning tool for basic electrical work, but in a fun way! (Because let's face it, soldering sucks!) I will definitely keep an eye out for more sales on the add-on sets for future gifts!
customer_reviews.author: woolyshamblers

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Holiday gift for my 8yo son. He LOVES IT. ☺ He has done many of the projects already. They start off very simple/gradually increase in complexity. He hasn't needed our help at all although he enjoys us sitting with him or bringing it over to show us. He is so excited and proud each time the circuit works. I highly recommend this product. It's very fun and educational. I read you can also purchase extension/upgrade kits for it so I'm excited to have that option in the future. 110% would buy again ;)
customer_reviews.author: Johnny and Samantha G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Educational Toy!
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of the BEST gifts we've gotten for our son. It's simple enough for a 5-6 year old to do along with an adult for help, but can be used in conjunction with the more elaborate sets as well as they grow. He still loves this and it's a great teaching tool for us as well. He is fascinated with seeing how the electric set works and trying new combinations and we don't have to worry about him being injured, as it all just snaps together.
customer_reviews.author: Trista

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning Toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for having fun while learning. I originally saw this product in a school, and when my nephew's 8th birthday came around, I thought it would be a fun new thing for him. This toy allows children to put all the different pieces together and make different parts work. You can run a fan or turn on a light and find different ways to make that happen. It gives the child a sense of accomplishment when they complete the project and get to see it working. For young children, the first few projects may require help. Once they understand the concept, they can cruise through many projects and have a fun time doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Good with a small snag
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift (today) Very cool little set. However, there was an issue with the red jumper wire.. it actually appeared to be cut? Looking for a way to contact seller. I'm guessing from the good reviews this is a fluke. Overall, the item looks to be good quality (according to my husband.. way more knowledgeable about these things than myself). He said he was odd the way the wire way severed? Anyway, he said he can "fix" it but a bit disappointing to my young, impatient boys.
customer_reviews.author: Angela!

customer_reviews.title: Intially may require some guidance from adults, child dependent
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. My 7 yo, nearly 8, granddaughter loves playing with this. But has yet to grasp the lessons within. Explaining what is going on helps her get the basic ideas. But it will take a very inquisitive child to get anything out of this beside funs. If left to it alone I'm sure she would eventually burn out the led and perhaps the bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Great for young children
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gift for a young kid. Bought it for my (advanced) 5 year old and he loves it. I helped him with the first couple projects so he knew how to read the schematics and then after that, I let him do it on his own and pointed out any mistakes to him if he made any. I do have to explain to him what's going on with each circuit, but he likes to test it out when it's done and also swap parts around to see what happens. You can't make a radio with it and that type of stuff, but young kids will enjoy it and definately learn from it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Matias

customer_reviews.title: Super fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10yo son who loves STEM activities. It is such a neat product. I think the price is definitely worth the product. It comes with the board and many circuits and a fan, and other trinkets and a book that shows you how to design different circuits. They all work great! There's one that causes the fan to blow and buzzers to buzz! It's fun, he stays busy with it for a couple hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Denisse Ramos

customer_reviews.title: fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for 8 and 6 year old girls. Both of them are really enjoying it! I love that it is educational and very child friendly. It took a bit longer for the 6 year old to get the concept but the 8 year old got it pretty quick. They can now make circuits independently and even use it for pretend play! When they play "space travel", they use the space war sounds circuit and mount the board on their space ship! It captivates them for long periods and they have been playinh with it every day for 3 weeks now since we got it.
customer_reviews.author: Iman Mahmoud

customer_reviews.title: Go for it, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got this at the age of 5.5 and she absolutely loves it. She needed some help at the beginning to understand how parts work, but she can now reproduce the circuits from the book by herself, and invent new ones through trial and error. She really enjoys this a lot and can spend an hour on this by herself. She is also really happy to show it when she has older friends come over, and it's convenient to have an activity that is also of interest for 8/9 year old bigger siblings. A great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: B-in-SEA

customer_reviews.title: A month later was told "best gift ever" from the 6 year old recipient
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to a 6 year old, and a month after he got it, his mom relayed to me that he said it was "the best present ever" - and hearing that new a month after he got it I feel pretty happy with this as a gift!
customer_reviews.author: K80_k

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids who like circuit building
customer_reviews.text: We always love all these electronics kits! My kids first played with them in our library so we knew they'd like them. That's my only caveat is to start with Elenco's smaller/less $ sets first, to gauge if your child is interested in these circuit building kits. If a kid isn't no into circuits, might not be so interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Pround and Happy Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great for as young as 5 to learn physics
customer_reviews.text: We received the beginner kit as a gift for our nearly 5 year old and he fell madly in love with it. We decided to get this more challenging kit and he loves doing it with my husband. Yes, the sounds can be annoying. But learning a or science, specifically physics, seems to be a lot of fun for both of them!
customer_reviews.author: Rider16

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and easy-to-learn STEM toy
customer_reviews.text: This was a fantastic Christmas gift for my 7-year old. With just a little bit of supervision she just took off and wanted to spend hours on this. Even I got into it, and I am not usually very good at spatial or constructive activities. This is very well-designed for safety and easy to learn so that kids quickly get the concept of electrical circuits. The projects are entertaining and she felt so proud of herself for what she could do. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Maynards

customer_reviews.title: Probably my favorite toy purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: Probably my favorite toy purchase ever! I bought this as a Christmas gift for my 5 year old son almost a year ago and he initially showed no interest in the chaos. It sat unopened in the closet for almost a year. When I finally opened it my son hasn't stopped playing with it for 2 days. At first he needed help but now he likes to challenge himself to do the projects independently. Now THAT is the best gift ever for a parent!! I'm totally buying all the other sets this Christmas. :)
customer_reviews.author: Pollywannabuya

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my 6 year old Grandson
customer_reviews.text: He loves this. Well made and versatile, with a book that lays out all you need to know to make fun electronic circuits and understand how they function. it only took him a few times before he started making his own modifications to projects to get the functions he wanted. Very education and a lot of fun. Highly recommeneded
customer_reviews.author: Alexander E. Paulsen

customer_reviews.title: Fun set
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these! We’ve purchased two sets. It works consistently. I wish the instruction pamphlet was in card form and laminated for frequent use. It would hold up better that way. It would also be great if this came in a better little storage container. Otherwise, it’s a perfect little set.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: We Love it, Even for Age 5
customer_reviews.text: Our 5 year old got this for Christmas and loves it! He hasn’t mastered putting all the projects together perfectly, but he loves to try his own projects to see what he can make it do. He hasn’t broken anything yet either and he’s pretty rough. Our 7 year old loves it to. This set is hard to work on side by side since it’s a small set. For two kids to work in together, a bigger set may be best. Otherwise, this is a great gift for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Hours of interested!
customer_reviews.text: My six year old son love this! He will spend over an hour putting together the different circus. My son has put things together by himself and we have done it with him. It's a great tool for teaching creativity and Independence. If you have a kid that enjoys creating, building, and making things work this is a great gift! I would say it's great for ages 6 to 8 or 9, depending on child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My kids are having a blast with this and even five months later take it out to explore with it -  Snap Circuits Jr. SC-100 Elect
customer_reviews.text: My kids are having a blast with this and even five months later take it out to explore with it. I got is for a Christmas present for my budding 8YO and he loved putting some of the connections together. Just the other day(end of April), he had said to the 12YO 'do ya wanna put the harder ones together?' and they did. They were proud at the complexity of sound that they could make come together with this. Highly recommend as a fun learning tool/game/toy. Snap Circuits Jr. SC-100 Electronics Discovery
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper 808

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful concept! Easy to understand instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful concept! The quality is great, so many projects to build and very well-explained instruction! I bought this set for my 5 years old girl. It arrived on my husband’s birthday. The very first project my daughter built all by herself accidentally included a speaker which sang “happy birthday” song! I never knew this when ordering it! We were so surprised and happy! I would give this set more than 5 stars if possible!
customer_reviews.author: SnowyRose

customer_reviews.title: Best quality and toy for new learning
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing My girl loves it and enjoy it very much. Needs an adult around for the first time but after that she got it and wanted to play with it all the time. She is 4year old but very developed and some of her older 6-7 years old friends love it too. Good as a gift as well.
customer_reviews.author: Heni

customer_reviews.title: Motor may be defective?
customer_reviews.text: I really love this product, but we cannot get the coolest activity to work. No matter what we do, the fan will not disconnect (flying saucer or #12). I bought this specifically for this activity after playing with a friend’s snap circuit jr kit and launching the fan off the motor. It would be a solid 5 stars for children ages 4+ (at least for the first 15 activities or so), but not when it can’t launch a fan. Maybe it’s defective?
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Sueppel

customer_reviews.title: Great introductory to circuits
customer_reviews.text: We saw these at a child STEM center in the city last autumn before this pandemic craziness and ordered them for our daughter, who had a lot of fun with them on that trip. She has fun now building little widgets and loves showing them to her friends. She's only 6 years old but these things are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Science camp in a box - great summer project
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this project. It is like science camp in a box. I have a 7 yr old grandson that has been disassembling everything he can get his hands on. I decided to teach him how to build circuits. I have a background in electronics from the military but it would not be hard to just follow the book and create things even if you don't.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Bangerter

customer_reviews.title: Really fun toy
customer_reviews.text: My 7 yr old loves this. I like playing too. He loves fans, switches, and lights in general so this was a slam dunk gift. I would have liked more explanation of the principles in the directions to help him learn about electric circuits. But he enjoys playing with it every day. If a child can follow a recipe, he/she can build the projects independently. If not, a little help will be needed, but playing too is a good thing either way. I will likely buy a different set to go with it to have more variety of pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Great For Teaching Electric And Electronic Theory
customer_reviews.text: One hundred projects? Well about half are modifications of something similar: series and parallel circuits, different resistances, and so on. Makes the kit great for teaching. However it gets boring as a gift unless the receiver really wants to learn everything about electronics. For that person, it would be a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: JP KazarianTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good to create curiosity and learning about science - especially electricity
customer_reviews.text: Nice little kit to create curiosity and learn science in creative ways. Would love to see the additional items sold as accessories than buying the upgraded kits all over. Keeps engaged and we don't need to worry about having any accidents even when kids are working on their own.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Great educational STEM gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy for my five-year-old and he absolutely loves it! They're over hundred projects to build with the included instruction manual which is done by photo so he can read very well. He's beginning to understand how to close circuits and how they work. Great projects that at age 5 will require some I don't guidance the first few times. We also have younger siblings which are not allowed to be in the area while big brother is working on this. There are some very small pieces which are very easy to break it to choke for my three-year-old and one-year-old. This would be a perfect gift that is also educational and S TEM friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Av8her

customer_reviews.title: Great educational project kit
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old son loves to play with that toy and create new circuits, identifying the problem if the circuit does not work and follows it step by step to find the missing link. It is a great educational project kit for children learning about electric circuits.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Surprise hit with the kids!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12-year-old daughter for Christmas, and at first she didn't have much interest in it until she opened it and actually started playing with it. Now she LOOOOVES it. She had fun putting together all of the different configurations and seeing what they do, and we look forward to getting more sets. My 6-year-old son was even able to build some of the more complicated configurations and he wants sets of his own too! They're great toys for learning about electrical currents and how those work.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kolesar

customer_reviews.title: High quality. Highly educational.
customer_reviews.text: High quality. Highly educational. Made in Malaysia product. Loved the educational value. My 3 yrs old now knows that resistor causes sound or light to dim down. He knows diode. Amazing!! Would had liked it more, had it provided more interactive sounds or engaging articulation like fan. Nevertheless recommend this product hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: Very fun
customer_reviews.text: It comes with lots of accessories. My son loves the fan and the speaker parts. Especially the speaker , different combinations make different sounds. The instruction is very clear for each project. It’s a great toy idea combine fun and learning. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: William W

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended by a friend. I hesitated because my grandson is only five and the appropriate age on the packaging is 8+. I built the first item with him on Christmas Day. He was "freestyling" soon after. His imagination was working in high gear. He even created a flashlight to take to bed that night. First thing in the morning....he was back at it. He commented that he would like to use the kit with his Legos. Well....there is a kit available to combine the Snap Circuits with Legos!
customer_reviews.author: Ann K.

customer_reviews.title: Great educational toy. Hours of distraction.
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product. It is the perfect combination of education and entertainment for curious young minds. Learn about circuits while building fun devices and having enough freedom to go beyond the included book and make your own interesting combinations. I bought this for a smart 8 year old and he was occupied for hours. I also enjoyed working with him on the projects and it seems to be a good project for kids to work on with their parents.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again and again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 year old son and he loves it! He always wants more and I have also bought other sets. I have also bought this as a gift for my 8 year old nephew and he loves it too. When my son has friends over, they play with this and create all sorts of circuits. This set is the best one for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Meg Libertucci

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 year old girl since she seems to have the mechanical type brain. We started doing the projects together and now she has taken off. The instructions are simple and the completion of a project is satisfying especially when the light/buzzer/music or whatever comes on. Now my other kids want to jump and play to. Very good to learn about circuits, but also how to follow instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great starter set
customer_reviews.text: Snap circuits are an excellent intro to stem for kids-and this is a nice general starter kit. It’s not too expensive but has a wide variety of parts-it’s a nice intro to the concept before splurge if on the more expensive sets. It makes a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Msm

customer_reviews.title: Not a great learning toy, but fun anyway
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure this really does much to teach a child about circuitry, but my 7-year-old finds it fun nonetheless. What he really found fun was building circuits that got the propeller spinning. When it is switched off, the propeller goes flying up into the air. Other than that, the circuit designs are a bit repetitive, so he's only done a few of the designs, i.e. the ones that get sounds, lights, or motors working with the least effort. It seems there could be some more documentation/explanation to assist the young mind with the how and why this stuff works. Putting the circuits together is little more than following a diagram, ala Lego.
customer_reviews.author: S. Surasky

customer_reviews.title: Best Amazon purchase I've ever made!
customer_reviews.text: Can I give this 6 stars? My 6 year old son didn't ask me ONCE today for his tablet, video game or to play on my phone. He ignored a new movie on TV (one he had been BEGGING to see) because he was playing with this toy. He spent a couple hours working with his dad, a couple experimenting by himself and another few HOURS working through the projects with his aunt. I LOVE THIS TOY!
customer_reviews.author: SnappinMom

customer_reviews.title: This was absolutely amazing! My son is almost 4
customer_reviews.text: This was absolutely amazing! My son is almost 4, and we thought he'd have no interest in this. Pleasantly surprising to us, he was very engaged from the very beginning, first observed us building things out, and gradually started participating himself. We don't expect him to understand the concepts behind the scene, but are nonetheless encouraged by his strong motivation.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super awesome toy (my kid loves it too
customer_reviews.text: Super awesome toy (my kid loves it too!) I only wish the manual would explain a bit more about what's happening in each circuit. There are a few where the path seems to both bypass and travel through a specific item, and I can't figure out why it works like that. Anyway, I already bought the second upgrade kit (with computer interface) for more complex models. Can't wait to play with that one.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R.

customer_reviews.title: 8 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for Christmas for 8 year old neighbor. I would say he's above average in intelligence and skill, so he dug right in. He's been playing with it for 3 days non-stop. The instructions are a little vague for a younger kid, so anticipate spending time with them building and learning about different types of circuits. His favorite feature in the fan motor and being able to launch the rotor with by turning the switch off.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M.

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 year old son, and he really enjoys playing with it. At the start, it was a little complicated for him and he needed some help to get the idea of what he was supposed to do with the kit. So we worked with him on some of the projects in the included booklet for a little while, and then he began to make his own custom circuits (which surprised me). Interestingly, he started building his own circuits without snapping the pieces to the grid baseplate, and did it more "lego" style. I would definitely recommend this toy, and I'll probably be purchasing more kit for my kids some time in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun
customer_reviews.text: Santa brought both my kids a snap circuit set. This one for my 8 year old. We finally busted it out this weekend and he loves it. It does require a bit of parental help for when he puts a piece in backward, or is missing a small piece. But most of the projects he has been able to do himself. The instructions are colorful and well done. The introduction to electricity pages in the instructions are helpful for parents that need help.
customer_reviews.author: B. Benton

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning Toy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for a 9 year old. This is a great gift idea for children that is not only enjoyable but also helps them learn. It does provide a good hands-on experience in designing and building models of working electrical circuits. There are enough projects to play with including working models of a photo sensor, a flashing light, and an adjustable-volume siren. I wish this was available during my childhood- it would have helped me immensely and given me a head start toward my engineering degree!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Kids absolutely loved it, and we had a line of kids ...
customer_reviews.text: I was manning a booth for "Science in the Park" with about 6 of these kits. Kids absolutely loved it, and we had a line of kids waiting for their turn to create their own circuits. The book provided with the kid challenges kids to create circuits in different way - circuit design with the fan "blade" was a crowd favorite. Parents asked me if we were selling these and we directed them to purchase from Elenco. You're welcome Elenco LOL
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Fernandes

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my 5 yo son after he fell in love with the set at our local science museum. He can follow the instructions for the simpler circuits and we have just as much fun helping him with the more difficult circuits. He's been enthralled with putting things together and figuring out how they work from a very early age, so this set hit the nail on the head for him!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Davis

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS NOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. It is summer time here in autism land and the days are long and hard. No vacation here. This toy came up and I jumped on it. My son is 11 and is pretty impacted by his autism. He loves this toy. It has easy to follow directions, it is like a puzzle really. What I love about it is that it is open to interpretation on what to make! It makes you think about why theconnections are made and how. We made different types of fan blades and have attached them to the spinner. We made a wheel to win prizes. This is THE BEST TOY. If you have a curious child, you need this!!
customer_reviews.author: CedarWho7

customer_reviews.title: Science Fun
customer_reviews.text: As a teacher, I have used this in my classroom to teach students about circuits and electricity. I bought one for my 6 year old son to play with at home too. While he couldn't read the different instructions, he was easily able to just look at the pictures and recreate what he saw. I love STEM "toys."
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Louise

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: These snap circuits are really cool. I'm not sure if my son is actually learning how it works, but he's having fun putting it together and seeing what they do. Easy to follow instructions, I bought a carrying case made for these and am glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: hthornhill

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Perfect for your little STEM/scientist. My daughter had used this in her gifted classroom at school and already knew how to work it some but there are a ton of circuits to try using several materials. I believe you could try and create your own too. My daughter is only 7 so we haven’t branched our yet.
customer_reviews.author: CTCopling

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy - Educational & Engaging
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 5 year old and he has been on it day or night. He wakes up and goes directly to this box of toys. The instructions are great. The quality of the pieces are solid and making the circuits is awesome. Wish this was part of a building block where you could buy add-ons. Haven't looked hard as yet, hoping there is.
customer_reviews.author: Suresh Nair

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a last minute gift for our 6 year old that wasn't a toy. I came across this and decided to impulse buy. So glad I did. He can spend hours trying this. For the first week we would do this together and now he likes to set up and sometimes do the book activities and other times see what kind of connections he can do himself. It's easy to follow the directions and it's great quality.
customer_reviews.author: mrsmel269Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts on my set...
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a nice set, my kid love it, but I got Missing parts on mine, therefore there are many projects that can't be done, that's the reason for the 1 stars.
customer_reviews.author: jose Lora

customer_reviews.title: My 5 Year Old Loves This!
customer_reviews.text: He’s able to do most of the projects on his own simply by looking at the plans. More complicated builds require a bit of assistance, a reminder to make sure the circuits are closed, and that the parts are facing the correct way. Watching him experiment and explore has been phenomenal. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: Very educational and fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot of fun, and a great tool for some high-value time with your budding technician. The pieces are solid, the layouts are clear, and the results are fun. I recommend this. My only gripe is that the motor in my kit was frozen up when it arrived. It started working after I gave it a spin, but it doesn't reach enough RPM to launch the "helicopter".
customer_reviews.author: Mojave Bob

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: My 5.5 year old son LOVES this! He does need to be supervised with one parent. The beginning levels are easy for him to duplicate on his own. He stays focused on it, especially with the red fan! When it jumps he laughs so much.
customer_reviews.author: DR1230

customer_reviews.title: Best toy and perfect gift!
customer_reviews.text: The set is well-made, and comes with crystal clear instructions, that even a 5-6 year old can understand from the pictures. I also gifted this to another kid, who loved it just as much as my own son. This will keep your kids busy for days, and the difficulty level is very easy, which encourages them to play independently and builds confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Panpra

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My 8 years old love it and found it interesting. Its a great game and learning tool. The product is good quality, well arranged and can be easily stored back in order in the box. What I would like to see more explanation of the components and how they work.
customer_reviews.author: Eyo Moh

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Gift for Curious Minds
customer_reviews.text: My 7 yo niece and 2 yo nephew absolutely love this! They were fascinated with making the parts move, and couldn’t wait to try a new project. The 2 yo needed help, but the 7 yo had no problem connecting the circuits. Great toy to encourage critical thinking with hands on application. They liked it so much I bought another set for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy for young kids to learn!
customer_reviews.text: What a great introduction to electronic circuits for the very young! We purchased this for our boys (6 and 8) at the time. Even the 6-year old could sit down with it all by himself and put together little creations. If they can read basic sentences and follow diagrams, any child can use this set. The projects progress from very, very simple and basic to more advanced, giving the child a chance to add just a bit more to his knowledge and understanding as they go. My sons learned that when something wasn't working (light, fan, etc.) they needed to check every connection again. Very educational and productive fun!
customer_reviews.author: Nicki Truesdell

customer_reviews.title: Good but not awesome for us
customer_reviews.text: Really surprised this one has so many stars. Neat concept and my kids (7&8 at the time) and I played with it for a while, but once you make the light light up or propeller go a few different ways the wow factor goes away. As reference my kids are fairly creative and enjoy building. They will play legos or cardboard box and duct tape for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

product_meta.title: Elenco Snap Circuits Jr. SC-100
product_meta.description:
Create Working Electronic Circuits Snap Circuits Jr (SC-100) comes with over 30 components to create 101 different electronic projects. The pieces, which include snap wires, slide switches, an alarm circuit, a music integrated circuit, and a speaker, snap together easily on the included plastic grid--no soldering required. Each piece is numbered and color-coded to make identifying them easy. These components combine to create working circuit boards just like the ones found inside televisions, radios, and other electronic devices. With its easy-to-follow instructions, Snap Circuits gives your child a hands-on education in how electrical circuits work to run the everyday devices that they're familiar with. They'll also gain valuable lessons in building and in following instructions. The project manual includes large color illustrations and simple directions for each project. The projects include a sound-activated switch, a musical doorbell, a voice-controlled lamp, a flying saucer, and a light police siren. With these projects, children will experiment with things like electric switches, integrated circuits, digital circuits, fuses, and the transformation of circuit sounds into other sounds. Includes: Plastic snap-grid, 32 electrical components, and 1 project manual.Recommended for children 8 years and older.

AMAZON.COM
Give your child an exciting, hands-on introduction to electronics with Elenco Electronics Snap Circuits Jr. SC-100. This innovative kit contains over 30 color-coded, real circuit components that snap together to create working electronic circuits and devices. Recommended for children 8 and older, this set offers 101 do-it-yourself projects that will give your child an entertaining, concrete education on how electronics work.

 

Create Working Electronic Circuits
Snap Circuits comes with over 30 pieces to create 101 different electronic projects. The pieces, which include snap wires, slide switches, an alarm circuit, a music integrated circuit, and a speaker, snap together easily on the included plastic grid--no soldering required. Each piece is numbered and color-coded to make identifying them easy. These components combine to create working circuit boards just like the ones found inside televisions, radios, and other electronic devices. Simple, Fun Projects Let Kids Learn While They Play
With its easy-to-follow instructions, Snap Circuits gives your child a hands-on education in how electrical circuits work to run the everyday devices that they're familiar with. They'll also gain valuable lessons in building and in following instructions. The project manual includes large color illustrations and simple directions for each project.

 The projects include a sound-activated switch, a musical doorbell, a voice-controlled lamp, a flying saucer, and a light police siren. With these projects, children will experiment with things like electric switches, integrated circuits, digital circuits, fuses, and the transformation of circuit sounds into other sounds.

 Grow as You Go
Because the projects are arranged in order of complexity, kids can build on their skills as they progress through the manual. The lessons start out with a simple electric light and switch project that demonstrates how electricity is turned on and off with a switch. Further along, kids can put together a two-speed fan, create clap-controlled sounds, and more.

 Design Your Own Circuits and Upgrade Your Kit
Once children have mastered several of the techniques introduced in this kit, they can use the components to experiment and create their own customized circuits and electronic devices. The Snap Circuits Jr. SC-100 can also be upgraded to the Snap Circuits SC-300, Snap Circuits Pro, or Snap Circuits Extreme with the purchase of a UC-30, UC-40, UC-60 upgrade kits, respectively. Kids will enjoy additional parts, manuals, and projects that'll take their kit--and their fun--to the next level.

 Snap Circuits Jr. SC-100 requires two AA batteries, which are not included.

 What's in the Box
Plastic snap-grid, 32 electrical components, and 1 project manual.
feature_bullets: With this building toy, young engineers can assemble over 100 different electronic circuit projects with just 30+ electronic parts.
Kids can construct working models of a photo sensor, a flashing light, an Adjustable-Volume siren and much more!
This stem kit comes with a clear, easy to understand illustrated instruction manual
No tools needed! All parts Just click together and support a vigorous STEM/ steam educational curriculum.
Learn by doing. Designed for young engineers 8+.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
